alert.note: Alert for Charles City; Prince George; Southampton; Surry; Sussex (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 17 at 7:51PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN CHARLES CITY... NORTHEASTERN SOUTHAMPTON...NORTHEASTERN PRINCE GEORGE...EASTERN SUSSEX AND SURRY COUNTIES THROUGH 830 PM EDT... At 751 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Homeville, or 10 miles southwest of Wakefield, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small trees and blow around unsecured objects. Wind impacting handling of high profile vehicles. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Homeville around 755 PM EDT. Waverly around 800 PM EDT. Wakefield around 805 PM EDT. Claremont around 825 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Vicksville, Taylors Corner, Booth Fork, Carsley, Newville, Berlin, Yale, Spring Grove, Brandon, and Lumberton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Charles City; Prince George; Southampton; Surry; Sussex
